events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at an intersection, causing visible damage and requesting to file an official claim.
Upon reviewing the initial claim details, it was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in a collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's case, ensuring a smooth and personalized follow-up process.
The claim has been officially acknowledged, and the customer was informed about the next steps to be taken during the investigation period.
Request was sent to the customer for submitting the accident police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the driving license.
The customer submitted all the required documents including accident photos, police report, and insurance details for further processing.
The investigation team began reviewing the case files, verifying vehicle damages, and assessing liability based on submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded with a determination that the customer's vehicle was damaged due to no fault, confirming coverage validity.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repairs and loss of use, and the customer was informed about the proposed compensation amount.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the clear communication throughout the claim process.
Formal approval was granted for the claim settlement, authorizing the disbursement of funds to cover the vehicle repairs.
Payment was successfully processed and issued to the customer's designated account to facilitate timely vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed following confirmation of receipt of payment and customer confirmation of satisfaction with the resolution.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
